summary: This is a letter from defense attorneys Martin G. Weinberg, Reid Weingarten, and Michael Miller to Assistant United States Attorneys, supplementing a discovery request in the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. It requests the preservation and production of documents related to the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) and communications between the U.S. Attorney's Offices for the Southern District of Florida and the Southern District of New York, and the FBI, from 2007-2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

events.title: Initial Epstein Investigation
events.description: The lead prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida investigated Jeffrey Epstein from 2006 to 2008.

events.title: Prosecutor's Trip to New York
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of Florida traveled to New York in March 2008, presumably in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Discovery Request
events.description: The defense team electronically mailed their first request for discovery to the prosecution, seeking documents related to the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).

events.title: Supplemental Discovery Request
events.description: The defense team sent this letter to supplement their first discovery request, particularizing requests for documents from the Southern District of Florida and FBI offices.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking discovery related to the 2008 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) and communications between federal prosecutors in Florida and New York.
The request specifically targets documents from the lead prosecutor in the 2006-2008 Florida investigation, including communications from a March 2008 trip to New York.
The defense seeks information about communications with victim-witnesses regarding their right to confer with prosecutors outside of Florida.
The request covers a broad timeframe from 2007 to 2019 for communications and sharing of investigatory information between the Florida and New York offices and the FBI.
